tweets.text: We've seen a lot of rain across the #Midlands in recent weeks. The ground is saturated and rivers full. Just a small amount of rainfall could see the risk of flooding increase again and flood warnings issued. Stay #FloodAware https://t.co/eAha3Se3q6

Councillors in Cambridgeshire are calling on the @EnvAgency to explain why legal action has not been taken against those responsible for illegally dumping 122,000 tonnes of waste in the Fens.
https://t.co/oYjI8zSYBs

Road Policing continues. This is a light goods waste movement operation with our EA partners @EnvAgencySE. Scrap metal, hazardous material, roadworthiness and document checks along with appropriate waste licences. This is in Portsmouth today. #JOUCVU https://t.co/HwmxLuk1jZ

Further rain forecast over the next 24 hours please keep checking your #flood risk. 

üëâDo not drive through #flood water ‚Äì 30 cms could float your car

üëâLatest information on #flood warnings

https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/sszuve6D17

Please don‚Äôt drive through flood water  
1. Just 30cm can float an average family-sized car 
2. It's the #1 cause of death during flooding 
3. Over ¬æ of cars rescued from floods have to be written off 
4. Just 1 egg-cup of water sucked into your engine will wreck it 
Convinced? https://t.co/G9MqMVgSaC

@Indy_Narwal @Khalsa_Aid @cookham @BBCBerkshire @MCC_NT @EnvAgency @RaviSinghKA Hi Indy and the @Khalsa_Aid team. 
The people to contact with your kind offers of help are at the Environment Agency @MariaHerlihyEA @MarkHill03 #TeamEA and also Community Support groups at local councils. Thank you and Good Luck!

A planning application has been submitted for the first phase of the #Preston & South Ribble #Flood Risk Management Scheme.

We've worked alongside partners to develop plans for a ¬£49 million scheme that will reduce flood risk to 4,800 homes & businesses: https://t.co/g1aXy0cRtn https://t.co/sss0ID2jqv

You are 100% right, Dr Paul! I have met @EnvAgency frontline folk in a variety of capacities and they are dedicated underpaid people who work there to help make a difference. That their 'superiors' - a term I use in the loosest sense - behave like this for huge salaries is sick. https://t.co/N5LqxiMwjV

.@EnvAgencySE can anything be done about the regular flooding under the two bridges under the Slough to Windsor railway and the A355 road?
They flood a few times every winter, but it's been particularly bad this year making them impassable in an otherwise usable cycle path. https://t.co/Y6GCBBzWHE
